title: A 500 general error occurs
content:
A 500 general error occurs when you access one of the following components in Suite Administration:

  • Accounts, Tenants, or Customers
  • Users
  • Licenses, License pools, or Assignments
  • Configurations

Cause

The related component is Offline, Pending, or Init.

Solution

Accounts, Tenants, or Customers

You may encounter a 500 general error when you access Accounts, Tenants, or Customers. If this error is displayed:

  1. Run the kubectl get pod -n <NAMESPACE> | grep bo command to check the pod's status and see if any component is Offline, Pending, or Init.
    itom-bo-ats-deployment-<number>-<hash>
    itom-bo-facade-deploymen-<number>-<hash>
  2. If there is any Offline component, log in to a control plane node of the suite and run the kubectl logs <POD NAME> -n <NAMESPACE> -c <Container Name> command to check the log.

Users

You may encounter a 500 general error when you access Users. If this error is displayed:

  1. Run the kubectl get pod -n <NAMESPACE> | grep bo command to check the pod's status and see if any component is Offline, Pending, or Init.
    itom-bo-user-deployment-<number>-<hash>
    itom-bo-user-offline-deployment-<number>-<hash>
    itom-bo-facade-deployment-<number>-<hash>
  2. If there is any Offline component, log in to a control plane node of the suite and run the kubectl logs <POD NAME> -n <NAMESPACE> -c <Container Name> command to check the log.

Licenses, License pools, or Assignments

You may encounter a 500 general error when you access Licenses, License pools, or Assignments. If this error is displayed: 

  1. Run the kubectl get pod -n <NAMESPACE> | grep bo command to check the pod's status and see if any component is Offline or Pending.
    itom-bo-license-deployment-<number>-<hash>
  2. Run the kubectl get pod -n <NAMESPACE> | grep autopasscommand to check the pod's status and see if any component is Offline or Pending.
    autopass-lm-<number>-<hash>
  3. If there is any Offline component, log in to a control plane node of the suite and run the kubectl logs <POD NAME> -n <NAMESPACE> -c <Container name> command to check the log.
  4. If there is any error log in autopass-lm-<number>-<hash>, please refer cdf document.

Configurations

You may encounter a 500 general error when you access Configurations. If this error is displayed: 

  1. Run the kubectl get pod -n <NAMESPACE> | grep bo command to check the pod's status and see if any component is Offline or Pending.
    itom-bo-config-deployment-<number>-<hash>
  2. Run the kubectl get pod -n <NAMESPACE> | grep suite command to check the status and see if any component is Offline, Pending, or Init.
    suite-conf-pod-itsma
    suite-installer-<number>-<hash>
  3. If there is any Offline component, log in to a control plane node of the suite and run the kubectl logs <POD NAME> -n <NAMESPACE> -c <Container Name>  command to check the log.
